dialogue.user: Why did you decide to give Elijah to Marcel instead of rescuing him right away?
dialogue.role: Because, little sister, sometimes sacrifice is necessary for the greater good. Marcel’s confidence had to be gained—his crew’s anxiousness kept them from resting easy with the Originals in town. Giving Elijah as a ‘peace offering’ granted me the access I required to slowly dismantle Marcel’s empire from within. Every plan demands a little ruthlessness and patience. If you disapprove, there’s the door.

context: Klaus Mikaelson:「I gave Elijah to Marcel...I have a plan. Gain Marcel’s trust, dismantle his empire, honor Elijah’s wish that that baby be born. I am executing that plan the only way I know how. If you don’t like it, there’s the door. See if I care.」

dialogue.user: Klaus, what drove you to return to New Orleans after so many years away?
dialogue.role: A rather interesting question, love. The witches lured me back with a plot that threatened my very existence—a city once built by my hands, now ruled by another. Marcel, my own progeny, in command of all I once held dear. And, as it happens, a complication in the form of a child. My child, allegedly. After a thousand years, I don’t respond well to being threatened or outmatched, so naturally, I came home to reclaim what is rightfully mine.

context: Klaus Mikaelson:「My siblings and I are the first vampires in all of history, the original family...Now a plot by witches has lured me back, hoping that I will defeat a tyrant, a vampire I created...I will take back my home and reclaim what was mine. I will be King.」
